State-of-the-art frameworks (CodeMind or REval) and benchmarks (CruxEval) usually focus on LLM's prediction of a given code's input/output or intermediate variable states/values on limited programs. However, there is no tool for more in-depth analysis of the results. However, recent years have shown almost exponential growth in attackers leveraging these software artifacts to launch software supply chain attacks. Past well-known software supply chain attacks include the SolarWinds, log4j, and xz utils incidents. Smart contracts are typically developed in a high-level language, compiled into bytecode, and executed in a virtual machine (VM) on the blockchain client. Consequently, the VM's performance significantly determines the execution speed of smart contracts, the clients' resource overhead, and even the exploitable vulnerabilities. EVM is currently the most widely adopted VM, and several …• Cites: ‪Defectchecker: Automated smart contract defect detection by …‬ https://scholar.google.com/scholar_alerts?view_op=list_alerts&hl=en (GScholar : 10 new citations to articles by Xin Xia)https://scholar.google.com/scholar_url?url=https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-981-96-1411-0_17&hl=en&sa=X&d=17420506717255603195&ei=ssGbZ9u4Gp2AieoPoYSBsQs&scisig=AFWwaeZg63r-64A_zNuTi1fy8ldx&oi=scholaralrt&hist=bI0g1IwAAAAJ:1036371892193003001:AFWwaeYEqsCP3hgfKcQJVL2iEpan&html=&pos=7&folt=citMM-SCS: Leveraging Multimodal Features to Enhance Smart Contract Code Search https://scholar.google.com/scholar_url?url=https://www.computer.org/csdl/journal/ts/5555/01/10855358/23QQVi5XhCg&hl=en&sa=X&d=7141525313787013511&ei=ssGbZ9u4Gp2AieoPoYSBsQs&scisig=AFWwaea7aaVnZq7zw-0JTEbYnVIG&oi=scholaralrt&hist=bI0g1IwAAAAJ:1036371892193003001:AFWwaeYEqsCP3hgfKcQJVL2iEpan&html=&pos=6&folt=cit C Shi, Y Xiang, J Yu, L Gao - IEEE Transactions on Software Engineering, 2025Semantic code search technology allows searching for existing code snippets through natural language, which can greatly improve programming efficiency. In practice, precise points-to analysis can be computationally expensive and may not scale well to larger programs. This thesis aims to improve the performance of points-to analysis without sacrificing precision by introducing a custom domain-specific abstraction to reduce the size of the problem. We implemented this approach in an MLIR-based tool called …• Cites: ‪Pointer analysis‬ https://scholar.google.com/scholar_alerts?view_op=list_alerts&hl=en (GScholar : 2 new citations to articles by Yannis Smaragdakis)https://scholar.google.com/scholar_url?url=https://is.muni.cz/th/hye23/Thesis_Archive.pdf&hl=en&sa=X&d=7783233712640039100&ei=J_WRZ5LBNYC96rQP1s772AY&scisig=AFWwaeZKj2Q1TsQp8MECNFiqAsU5&oi=scholaralrt&hist=bI0g1IwAAAAJ:3768286445485410327:AFWwaea9yImKI83YTHJLAcj-uJB5&html=&pos=1&folt=cit[PDF] Dialect-Based Points-to Analysis for MLIR https://scholar.google.com/scholar_url?url=https://is.muni.cz/th/hye23/Thesis.pdf&hl=en&sa=X&d=9637004371053937283&ei=J_WRZ5LBNYC96rQP1s772AY&scisig=AFWwaeYBNytItc6gB1GiDhsWy1b8&oi=scholaralrt&hist=bI0g1IwAAAAJ:3768286445485410327:AFWwaea9yImKI83YTHJLAcj-uJB5&html=&pos=0&folt=citR Konicar - 2024;Points-to analysis is a static analysis technique used in tools for tasks such as program optimization, bug detection, and security analysis. Applying Software Engineering (SE) techniques to critical and intricate systems, like networking and security systems, is imperative.
